description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the secure boot security feature bypass vulnerability (CVE-2024-38011), it's essential to apply the relevant security updates provided by Microsoft:

1. Download and install the appropriate KB updates based on your Windows version from the Microsoft Update Catalog.
2. Restart your system after the installation to ensure all changes are applied effectively.

**Details**:
- The following KB articles associated with this vulnerability should be addressed:
  - KB5040442 for Windows 11 Version 23H2 and 22H2.
  - KB5040431 for Windows 11 Version 21H2.
  - KB5040448 for Windows 10 x64-based and 32-bit Systems.
  - KB5040427 for Windows 10 Version 22H2 and Version 21H2 (both x64 and 32-bit).
- These updates fix an improper handling of length parameter inconsistency, safeguarding the system from potential exploits.
- Update packages can be found at:
  - [KB5040442](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040442)
  - [KB5040431](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040431)
  - [KB5040448](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040448)
  - [KB5040427](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040427).

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure the system is on the supported builds as listed above.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the updates.
